children.definition: DealData (N=62 PC deals, quantitative statistics only): $5-10M (32.4%), $15-20M (29.7%), $25-50M (21.6%), $60-100M (10.8%), $150M+ (5.4%). DLS Preferred (Row 6) specifies commitment as '$[___]' without market-standard sizing.
children.name: Market Size Buckets
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6

children.definition: Separate or combined multicurrency sub-facility permitting borrowing in EUR, GBP, or other approved currencies, with equivalent USD limit. Review Template (Row 18): 'Flag any non-USD currencies for revolver.' Geneva expert extraction: $440M Revolver with separate Euro TL at different pricing.
children.name: Multicurrency Tranche
children.definition_source: Review Template, Row 18 (revolver currencies)

children.definition: Additional revolving commitments available under the accordion or incremental facility provisions. DLS Preferred (Row 9): accordion available as '(i) increased commitments in respect of the Revolving Facility or (ii) an increase in the Term Facility or additional term facilities.' Review Template (Row 29): RCF incremental subject to cap.
children.name: Incremental Revolver Capacity
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 9 (Accordion — revolver increase); Review Template, Row 29 (RCF sub-limit)

children.definition: Maximum revolving credit facility commitment stated in the commitment schedule. DLS Preferred: '$[___]' with separate notation of maturity. Provides the liquidity buffer for working capital and general corporate purposes. Revolving loans plus outstanding letters of credit may not exceed aggregate revolving commitments at any time.

TS_REVOLVER_QUANTUM.label: Term Sheet - Revolver Quantum
exactPhrases: revolving credit commitment in an aggregate principal amount
revolving credit commitment in an aggregate principal amount

children.name: Revolver Commitment Amount
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (Revolver)

children.definition: Revolver matures before the term loan to avoid payment subordination. Review Template (Row 3): standard Revolver tenor 5-6 years, inside TL-B at 7 years. Universal convention in leveraged credit.
children.name: Inside Maturity Principle
children.definition_source: Review Template, Row 3 (Revolver 5-6 years, TL-B 7 years); DLS Preferred, Row 6

children.definition: Revolver maturity that springs earlier if specified conditions are not met (e.g., refinancing of senior notes or other debt by a certain date). Review Template (Row 3): 'Flag any deviation, springing maturities.'
children.name: Springing Maturity
children.definition_source: Review Template, Row 3 (springing maturities)

children.definition: Borrower's right to request revolver maturity extension, typically requiring individual lender consent. DLS Preferred (Row 17): Amend and Extend provisions describe extension mechanics requiring 'consent of only extending lenders of such class.'
children.name: Extension Option
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 17 (Amend and Extend)

children.definition: Final maturity date for the revolving facility. DLS Preferred: 'Maturity: [___] years.' Review Template standard: 5-6 years. Convention requires revolver maturity inside the term loan maturity to avoid effective subordination through payment timing.

extraction_refs.difficulty_note: Aligned from ontology=easy vs playbook=hard (playbook authority for extraction complexity)

TS_REVOLVER_TENOR.label: Term Sheet - Revolver Tenor
exactPhrases: fifth anniversary of the Closing Date
sixth anniversary of the Closing Date
fifth anniversary of the Closing Date
sixth anniversary of the Closing Date

children.name: Revolver Maturity
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (Revolver); Review Template, Row 3 (Debt Quantum: '5-6 years')

children.definition: Revolver margin matches term loan margin. Simplifies administration but may underprice revolving risk.
children.name: Same as Term Loan
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 8 (Term Loan)

children.definition: Number of pricing tiers and leverage thresholds for the revolver grid, typically matching TL grid structure.
children.name: Grid Pricing Levels
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 25 (Pricing Flex); KCT Cat 1 Item 3; Review Template Row 137 (Equity Co-Invest)

children.definition: Basis point reduction per revolver grid level, typically 25 bps matching TL grid steps.
children.name: Step-Down Size

children.definition: Revolver margin that steps down based on leverage performance. Typically wider range than TL grid (50-100 bps total range).
children.name: Leverage-Based Grid
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 13 (Leverage Ratios)

children.definition: whether the springing covenant trigger is a fixed dollar amount or reduces proportionally as the RCF commitment decreases; a fixed threshold that does not shrink with the facility becomes progressively easier to avoid
children.name: Fixed vs proportional threshold
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 1 Item 3

children.definition: provision that excludes revolver drawings used to fund capital expenditure investments from the calculation of whether the springing covenant threshold has been breached, reducing the occasions on which the financial covenant is tested
children.name: Capex drawing exclusion
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 1 Item 3

children.definition: ability of the borrower to repay the RCF below the springing threshold level after the end of the testing period, thereby avoiding the financial covenant test and curing a default that would otherwise have resulted
children.name: Post-period repayment avoidance
children.definition_source: KCT Cat 1 Item 3

children.definition: Interest rate margin on drawn revolver. Average base margin: 578 bps.
children.name: Revolver Applicable Margin
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 6 (Revolver); DLS Preferred Row 19 (Revolver); DLS Preferred Row 21 (Term Loan Margin); KCT Cat 1 Item 3; Review Template Row 3 (Debt Quantum); Review Template Row 4 (Commitment and giveaway); Review Template Row 12 (Minimum equity contribution); Review Template Row 15 (Revolver closing date draws); Review Template Row 16 (Revolver – borrowing notices); Review Template Row 17 (Revolver – additional borrowers); Review Template Row 18 (Revolver currencies); Review Template Row 20 (LCs); Review Template Row 21 ([DDTL – availability period]); Review Template Row 23 ([DDTL – use of proceeds]); Review Template Row 27 (Incremental DDTLs); Review Template Row 29 (Incremental – RCF sub-limit); Review Template Row 31 (Incremental – netting); Review Template Row 34 (Incremental – MFN); Review Template Row 62 (Leverage Ratio Calculations); Review Template Row 128 (Limited Conditionality Transactions); Review Template Row 137 (Equity Co-Invest); Review Template Row 138 (Pricing); Review Template Row 140 (RCF Commitment Fee); Review Template Row 141 (DDTL Commitment Fee); Review Template Row 142 (LC Fronting Fee); Review Template Row 149 (Waiver); Review Template Row 151 (Acquisition Agreement); Review Template Row 158 (Commitment/Underwriting Fee); Review Template Row 159 (Structuring Fee); Review Template Row 160 (Ticking Fee (Term/Revolver)); Review Template Row 161 (Delayed Draw Ticking Fee)

children.definition: Revolver floor matches term loan SOFR floor, maintaining rate parity across facilities.
children.name: Same as Term Loan
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 30 (Term Loan)

children.definition: Explicit SOFR floor for revolver, most commonly 1.00%.
children.name: Specified Floor Level
children.definition_source: Review Template Row 139 (Floor)

children.definition: Minimum base rate for revolver. 1.00% most common specific level. May differ from TL floor.
children.name: Revolver SOFR Floor
children.definition_source: Review Template Row 139 (Floor)

children.definition: Revolver CSA matches term loan CSA, typically 10 bps flat.
children.name: Same as Term Loan
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 8 (Term Loan); DLS Preferred Row 21 (Term Loan Margin); DLS Preferred Row 30 (a. Term Loan); Review Template Row 14 (Term Sheet); Review Template Row 127 (Other Term Sheet Issues – LCT, EoDs, Voting, Assignments, Pricing); Review Template Row 160 (Ticking Fee (Term/Revolver))

children.definition: Explicit CSA for revolver, typically 10 bps flat or tenor-differentiated.
children.name: Specified CSA Level

children.definition: SOFR credit spread adjustment for revolver. Standard: same as initial TL or 10 bps.

market_benchmarks.trend: Declining prevalence as SOFR becomes direct benchmark

children.name: Revolver Credit Spread Adjustment
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 7 (Letters of Credit)

children.definition: Advance notice for revolver draws. DLS Preferred (Row 6): LIBOR/SOFR Loans '3 business day prior'; Base Rate Loans '1 business day prior.' Review Template (Row 16): confirm operational notice periods.
children.name: Notice Period
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (notice periods); Review Template, Row 16

children.definition: Minimum per-draw amount for revolver. DLS Preferred (Row 6): 'Minimum Borrowings: $[___]/$[___].'
children.name: Minimum Draw Amount
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (Minimum Borrowings)

children.definition: Whether revolver permits same-day borrowing at Base Rate without advance notice. DLS Preferred (Row 6): same-day borrowings 'will be issued under a swingline facility.' Review Template (Row 19): 'some agents prefer same-day base rate advances in lieu of formal swingline.'
children.name: Same-Day Base Rate Borrowing
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (same-day base rate via swingline); Review Template, Row 19

children.definition: Whether revolver can be drawn at closing. DLS Preferred (Row 6 alternative): 'Availability at closing not to exceed $[___] which will be used to (1) pay the acquisition costs and (2) finance ordinary course working capital needs.' Review Template (Row 15): closing-date draws for 'OID/upfront fees, working capital, and backstop/cash collateralize LCs.'
children.name: Closing Date Draws
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (closing date availability); Review Template, Row 15 (closing date draws)

children.definition: Mechanism allowing designated subsidiaries to borrow directly under the revolving facility. Review Template (Row 17): 'additional borrowers often require KYC and jurisdictional constraints. Align borrower-addition flexibility with agent requirements and tax structuring needs.'
children.name: Additional Borrowers
children.definition_source: Review Template, Row 17 (additional borrowers — KYC and jurisdictional constraints)

children.definition: Procedural requirements for revolver borrowings. DLS Preferred (Row 6): LIBOR/SOFR Loans 3 BD notice, Base Rate Loans 1 BD notice, Swingline same-day, Minimum Borrowings $[___], no more than [5] series outstanding, conversion/continuation mechanics. Review Template (Row 16): 'Confirm operational notice periods.'

TS_REVOLVER_BORROWING_NOTICE.label: Term Sheet - Revolver Borrowing Notice
exactPhrases: not later than [time] on the [•] Business Day prior
not later than [time] on the [•] Business Day prior

children.name: Revolver Borrowing Mechanics
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (Revolver borrowing mechanics); Review Template, Row 16

children.definition: Single unused commitment fee rate throughout the loan term. Typical: 50 bps in PC, 25-37.5 bps in BSL.
children.name: Flat Fee Rate
children.definition_source: Review Template Row 127 (Other Term Sheet Issues – LCT, EoDs, Voting, Assignments, Pricing); Review Template Row 140 (RCF Commitment Fee); Review Template Row 141 (DDTL Commitment Fee); Review Template Row 158 (Commitment/Underwriting Fee); Review Template Row 160 (Ticking Fee (Term/Revolver))

children.definition: Commitment fee that varies with leverage ratio performance, typically 2-3 pricing levels with 12.5 bps steps.
children.name: Leverage-Based Fee Grid
children.definition_source: Review Template Row 140 (RCF Commitment Fee)

children.definition: Fee accrues daily on undrawn amount (excluding LC exposure) and is payable quarterly in arrears and on revolving facility maturity date.
children.name: Accrual & Payment Mechanics

children.definition: Annual fee on undrawn revolving commitments, compensating lenders for maintaining available credit. Expressed as basis points per annum on daily unused commitment. Neutron extraction context (PRICING_RCF_COMMITMENT_FEE): Fee paid on undrawn revolver commitments, typically expressed as a percentage with potential leverage-based step-downs. Compensates lenders for availability. Revolver commitment fees compensate for undrawn availability; step-downs at lower leverage are common.

PRICING_RCF_COMMITMENT_FEE.label: Revolver Commitment Fee
PRICING_RCF_COMMITMENT_FEE.description: Fee paid on undrawn revolver commitments, typically expressed as a percentage with potential leverage-based step-downs. Compensates lenders for availability.
PRICING_RCF_COMMITMENT_FEE.backgroundExplanation: Revolver commitment fees compensate for undrawn availability; step-downs at lower leverage are common. The sources suggest treating super-senior revolver cap increases as sacred rights and aligning fee adjustments across incremental revolver capacity to keep syndicate expectations stable. Commitment fees are typically 30-50% of the applicable margin and are paid quarterly in arrears.
PRICING_RCF_COMMITMENT_FEE.summary_used: Fee paid on undrawn revolver commitments, typically expressed as a percentage with potential leverage-based step-downs. Compensates lenders for availability. Revolver commitment fees compensate for undrawn availability; step-downs at lower leverage are common.

children.name: Revolver Commitment Fee
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred Row 5 (Commitment Percentage); DLS Preferred Row 20 (Unused Line Fee); DLS Preferred Row 31 (Revolving Facility underwriting fee); DLS Preferred Row 32 (Ticking fee); DLS Preferred Row 33 (Alternate transaction fee); DLS Preferred Row 35 (Administration fee); Review Template Row 2 (Commitment Letter / Transaction Description); Review Template Row 8 (Expense Reimbursement); Review Template Row 9 (Countersign date); Review Template Row 12 (Minimum equity contribution); Review Template Row 15 (Revolver closing date draws); Review Template Row 18 (Revolver currencies); Review Template Row 21 ([DDTL – availability period]); Review Template Row 140 (RCF Commitment Fee); Review Template Row 141 (DDTL Commitment Fee); Review Template Row 142 (LC Fronting Fee); Review Template Row 157 (Fee Letter); Review Template Row 160 (Ticking Fee (Term/Revolver)); Review Template Row 162 (Agency Fee); Review Template Row 163 (Alternate Transaction Fee); Review Template Row 164 (Sponsor Participation)

children.definition: Maximum aggregate swingline borrowings outstanding at any time, expressed as a dollar sublimit within the revolving commitment. DLS Preferred (Row 6): 'Swingline Facility: (i) sublimit not to exceed $[___].' The sublimit reduces available revolving capacity dollar-for-dollar.
children.name: Swingline Sublimit
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (Swingline Facility sublimit specification)

children.definition: The designated lender that makes swingline advances, bearing initial funding risk before settlement with the revolving lender group. DLS Preferred (Row 6): 'Swingline Lender to provide swingline loans to Borrower prior to [___] p.m. on the date of the requested borrowing.' Typically the administrative agent or an affiliate.
children.name: Swingline Lender
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (Swingline Lender designation and funding obligation)

children.definition: Same-day funding mechanics for swingline loans, bypassing standard SOFR notice periods. DLS Preferred (Row 6): 'available to Borrower upon written notice to the Administrative Agent prior to [___] a.m./p.m. on the date of the requested borrowing' and 'Base Rate Loans only.' Swingline provides intraday liquidity without the 3-business-day SOFR notice requirement.
children.name: Overnight Borrowing Mechanics
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (same-day swingline: notice timing, Base Rate only)

TS_SWINGLINE.label: Term Sheet - Swingline
exactPhrases: provide swingline or same-day ABR borrowings
provide swingline or same-day ABR borrowings

children.definition: Process by which swingline advances are settled among revolving lenders, converting swingline exposure to pro rata revolving loans. DLS Preferred (Row 6): 'Swingline Lender will notify other revolving lenders of their pro rata portion of swingline loans and such lenders shall reimburse swingline lender within 1 business day of such notice.' Settlement shifts the funding risk from the swingline lender to the revolving group.
children.name: Settlement / Refunding Mechanics
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (swingline settlement: pro rata notification, 1 BD reimbursement)

children.definition: Short-term same-day borrowing sub-facility within the revolving credit facility, enabling rapid access to working capital without standard notice periods. DLS Preferred specifies: '(i) sublimit not to exceed $[___], (ii) available upon written notice prior to [___] a.m./p.m., (iii) Base Rate Loans only, (iv) swingline lender notifies other revolving lenders of pro rata portions within 1 business day.' Review Template: some agents prefer same-day base rate advances in lieu of formal swingline.
children.name: Swingline Sub-Facility
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (Swingline Facility within Revolver section); Review Template, Row 19 (Swingline)

children.definition: Maximum aggregate face amount of outstanding letters of credit, expressed as a dollar sublimit within the revolving commitment. DLS Preferred (Row 7): '$[___] (Letter of Credit Sublimit).' The aggregate face amount of issued LCs reduces revolving availability dollar-for-dollar. DealData (N=62, quantitative only): sublimit range $1M-$20M, average $5.3M.
children.name: LC Sublimit
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 7 (LC Sublimit definition)

TS_LC_SUBLIMIT.label: Term Sheet - LC Sublimit
exactPhrases: No requirement to share pro rata
No requirement to share pro rata

children.definition: Designated bank(s) that issue letters of credit under the facility. DLS Preferred (Row 7): 'the aggregate face amount of outstanding letters of credit issued by any Letter of Credit Issuer at any time shall not exceed the Letter of Credit Sublimit.' PC Term Comparison: 'Confirm who LC issuer will be. Clients often contract it out to third parties so LC Issuer definition may need to reflect that.'
children.name: LC Issuing Bank
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 7 (LC Issuer references); PC Term Comparison, LCs section

children.definition: Categories of letters of credit permitted under the facility. DLS Preferred (Row 7): 'Available for standby letters of credit or, if acceptable to the Letter of Credit Issuer, trade letters of credit.' PC Term Comparison: 'Confirm whether Clients can do commercial LCs and foreign currency LCs.' Standby LCs (performance/payment guarantees) are universally permitted; commercial/trade LCs require issuing bank agreement.
children.name: LC Types
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 7 (standby and trade LCs); PC Term Comparison, LCs section

children.definition: Fee paid to all revolving lenders on outstanding LC exposure, equal to the applicable revolving margin. DLS Preferred (Row 22): 'Letter of Credit Fee: LIBOR margin applicable to revolving loans and paid to all Revolving Lenders.' Compensates each revolving lender for its pro rata share of LC exposure.
children.name: LC Participation Fee
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 22 (LC participation fee = revolving margin)

children.definition: Fee paid to the issuing bank for bearing the fronting risk. Typically 12.5-25 bps per annum on face amount.
children.name: LC Fronting Fee
children.definition_source: Review Template Row 142 (LC Fronting Fee)

children.definition: Fee structure for letters of credit comprising three components. DLS Preferred (Row 22): 'Fronting Fee: 12.5 bps per annum to LC Issuer' and 'Letter of Credit Fee: LIBOR margin applicable to revolving loans and paid to all Revolving Lenders.' The participation fee (equal to applicable revolving margin) compensates the revolving lender group; the fronting fee compensates the issuing bank for bearing fronting risk.
children.name: LC Fee Structure
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 22 (LC Fees: fronting fee 12.5 bps, participation fee = revolving margin)

children.definition: Requirement to cash collateralize outstanding LCs upon certain events including revolver maturity, acceleration, or default. DLS Preferred (Row 7): LCs 'shall expire not later than the earlier of (a) 12 months after its date of issuance... and (b) the fifth business day prior to the final maturity of the Revolving Facility.' Cash collateralization at 103-105% of face amount ensures LC obligations are covered when the revolving facility terminates.
children.name: LC Cash Collateralization
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 7 (LC expiry and maturity provisions); Review Template (LC cash collateral mechanics)

children.definition: Letter of credit issuance capability as a sub-limit of the revolving facility. DLS Preferred: '$[___] (Letter of Credit Sublimit); available for standby letters of credit or, if acceptable to the Letter of Credit Issuer, trade letters of credit. Each LC expires not later than the earlier of 12 months and 5 business days prior to final revolver maturity. Face amount reduces revolver availability dollar-for-dollar.' Geneva expert extraction: LC Sublimit $100M.

TS_REVOLVER_AVAILABILITY.label: Term Sheet - Revolver Availability
exactPhrases: replace, backstop or cash collateralize LCs
finance a portion of the transactions
replace, backstop or cash collateralize LCs
finance a portion of the transactions

children.name: Letter of Credit Sub-Facility
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 7 (Letters of Credit)

children.definition: Number of consecutive days the revolver must be at zero or below the threshold during each annual period. Standard in BSL: 5 consecutive business days per year. The period must be short enough to be achievable but long enough to demonstrate genuine working capital self-sufficiency.
children.name: Clean-Down Period
children.definition_source: Review Template (revolver mechanics); Learning Material (working capital facility conventions)

children.definition: Maximum revolver outstanding permitted during the clean-down period. Zero is the strictest formulation; a small percentage of total commitment (e.g., 10-15%) is a borrower-friendly alternative that accommodates minimum operational cash needs.
children.name: Clean-Down Threshold
children.definition_source: Review Template (revolver utilization thresholds); Learning Material

children.definition: Requirement that revolver outstanding be reduced to zero (or a specified threshold) for a consecutive period each year, demonstrating working capital self-sufficiency rather than permanent term-loan-like utilization. More common in BSL and bank-led facilities. PC Term Comparison does not address clean-down as a hot-button item, suggesting it is not standard in private credit transactions.
dls_ref: DLS:11:Conditions to incurrence: Bring down of

market_benchmarks.bsl_typical: 5 consecutive days per year at zero

children.name: Clean-Down Requirement
children.definition_source: Review Template (revolver utilization monitoring); PC Term Comparison (absence suggests non-standard in PC)

children.definition: Borrower's right to permanently reduce revolving commitments without premium, typically with minimum reduction amounts and advance notice. DLS Preferred (Row 6): minimum borrowing amounts imply corresponding minimum reduction thresholds. Voluntary commitment reductions build the ECF sweep credit per DLS Row 70.
children.name: Voluntary Reductions
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (minimum amounts); DLS Preferred, Row 70 (voluntary reduction credit)

children.definition: Pre-agreed commitment reduction schedule reducing revolving availability over time. Uncommon in leveraged credit but present in some amortizing revolver structures. DLS Preferred does not contemplate scheduled revolver reductions, confirming this is a non-standard feature.
children.name: Scheduled Reductions
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (no scheduled revolver reduction)

children.definition: Events triggering automatic commitment reduction, such as asset sale proceeds or permanent prepayments in excess of scheduled amortization. DLS Preferred (Row 70): '100% of net cash proceeds from all non-ordinary course asset sales' applied to mandatory prepayment, which for revolver may trigger corresponding commitment reduction.
children.name: Mandatory Reductions
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 70 (asset sale and mandatory prepayment triggers)

children.definition: Voluntary and mandatory reductions of revolving commitments, permanently reducing available revolving credit capacity. DLS Preferred (Row 70): mandatory prepayments framework includes permanent commitment reductions. The distinction between voluntary and mandatory reductions affects the ECF sweep credit calculation.

market_benchmarks.mandatory: Automatic reduction upon asset sale or equity issuance
market_benchmarks.standard: Voluntary reduction in $1-5M increments, 3 business days notice

children.name: Commitment Reductions
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 70 (permanent commitment reductions in ECF context)

children.definition: Accounts receivable meeting eligibility criteria (age, concentration, dilution limits) included in the borrowing base at a specified advance rate. Standard eligibility excludes receivables >90 days past due, receivables from concentrated obligors exceeding percentage caps, and cross-aged accounts. The receivables component typically constitutes 60-70% of total borrowing base availability.
children.name: Eligible Receivables
children.definition_source: Learning Material (ABL collateral valuation); Review Template (ABL monitoring provisions)

children.definition: Inventory meeting eligibility criteria (type, location, appraisal) included in the borrowing base at a specified advance rate, typically lower than receivables to reflect greater liquidation risk. Excludes work-in-process, consigned goods, and inventory at non-controlled locations. Advance rates typically 50-65% of appraised orderly liquidation value.
children.name: Eligible Inventory
children.definition_source: Learning Material (ABL inventory valuation); Review Template (ABL appraisal requirements)

children.definition: Percentage of eligible asset values available for borrowing: typically 85% for eligible receivables and 50-65% for eligible inventory (at orderly liquidation value). Advance rates are set based on periodic field examinations and appraisals. Rates may be reduced by the agent if collateral quality deteriorates.
children.name: Advance Rates
children.definition_source: Learning Material (ABL advance rate conventions); Review Template (ABL monitoring)

children.definition: Discretionary or formulaic reductions to the borrowing base imposed by the administrative agent to protect against collateral valuation risk. Includes dilution reserves (for uncollectible receivables), availability reserves (for rent, taxes, or other priority claims), and specific reserves for identified risks. Agent typically has sole discretion to establish reserves.
children.name: Reserves
children.definition_source: Learning Material (ABL reserve mechanics); Review Template (agent discretion provisions)

children.definition: Periodic certification of the borrowing base calculation delivered by the borrower to the administrative agent. Frequency: monthly (standard), weekly (during trigger periods when availability drops below a specified threshold). DLS Preferred (Row 78) contemplates monthly financial statements for cash flow facilities; ABL certificates serve an analogous monitoring function.
children.name: Borrowing Base Certificates
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 78 (monthly financial delivery); Learning Material (ABL certificate frequency)

children.definition: Lender-conducted audits of receivables and inventory to verify borrowing base eligibility and advance rate adequacy. Frequency: 1-2x annually under normal conditions, increasing during trigger periods. DLS Preferred (Row 78): includes 'inspection rights (subject to frequency and cost reimbursement limitations)' in affirmative covenants. Cost borne by borrower.
children.name: Field Exams / Appraisals
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 78 (inspection rights); Learning Material (ABL field exam frequency)

children.definition: Asset-based lending mechanics where revolving availability is limited by a calculated borrowing base formula. Common in retail, distribution, and manufacturing credits where collateral value is measurable. PC Term Comparison does not address ABL as a hot-button item, indicating it is uncommon in sponsor-backed private credit. DLS Preferred contemplates cash flow-based revolvers rather than ABL structures.
children.name: ABL / Borrowing Base
children.definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (cash flow revolver as standard); PC Term Comparison (ABL absent from hot-button items)

definition: Committed revolving credit facility providing working capital and general corporate purpose liquidity, available for repeated borrowing and repayment during its term. DLS Preferred specifies: commitment amount '$[___]', maturity '[___] years', with sublimits for letters of credit and swingline loans. Availability at closing may be limited to specific purposes (OID funding, working capital, LC backstop). Review Template: standard 5-6 year maturity with alignment to marketing.
market_benchmarks: 50 bps (DLS preferred); 37.5-25 bps with leverage step-downs
name: Revolving Credit Facility
definition_source: DLS Preferred, Row 6 (Revolver); Review Template, Row 3 (Debt Quantum) and Row 15 (Revolver closing date draws)
